page.title: 05The Fields,Shenfield
page.content: There are various fields and woods in Shenfield.Three fields are used for barley and two are used for wheat.The woods are mostly deciduous.Among the fields there are burdock and camomile.One of the fields of barley was also used for growing potatoes.By the A12 there are two fields of wheat and barley.There is a field that is used for hay.Shenfield Hall farms barns are not used anymore but the silos are used instead.Saint Mary's church is opposite Saint Mary's school.In the church grounds there is a grave yard.Some of the graves date back to 1437.The playing fields are by Saint Mary's school.By the playing fields there are two more grave yards.
